title: Economic situation will worsen if political stability is not established soon – CBSL chief
body_lines: The Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe says that the economic situation in the country will become worse if political stability is not established soon.
Addressing a press briefing in Colombo today (11), Dr. Weerasinghe also said that he will step down as the Governor if political stability in the country is not established within a week or two.
